title: I love the Akali rework. But I am so disappointed in how they portrayed Akali and Kennen's relation.
body:
I don't know if I am being biased because of some idea I built up in my head, but going into this I always pictured Akali as loving Shen and Kennen deeply, but needing to leave them behind in order to forge her own path. 

I would have really loved for Shen to be portrayed more as a beloved teacher, and Kennen as a life-long friend that she had to leave behind. Now it's Kennen being a teacher and Shen being... also a teacher. But I don't feel any emotion attached to them in regards to Akali's POV. 

Being best buddies throughout life would've been a great dynamic for Akali and Kennen, we don't really have that with any other champions. *sigh*

replies.body: Well, she did learn alot from the little guy, it's in her bio. She has a soft spot for him. There's a line for that. She likes him. There were more lines, but in fitting with a stealthy assassin, we went with a smaller VO script to align with that. Check her out in game, where the lines are meant to be heard. Akali has reverence for the Kinkou, (how could she not?), but she gotta do her thing. Cheers!

I'll be honest that any respect she has for the Kinkou is kind of lost in-game; the only line I heard referencing it directly was that they "couldn't control her", and other than that line with Kennen she seems rather indifferent towards Shen.  I'm really enjoying her direction, though.

The only line I thought was weird was "The Fist of Shadow was my mom.  I do things differently."  Given that's her old title, I'm interested in learning whatever that means.

This was stated in the old lore, but Akali's basically born into the Kinkou by her mom, who was the Fist of Shadow alongside Master Kusho.
Old-Akali took up the mantle of Fist of Shadow, but as of her rework she's dropped the title after leaving the Kinkou to live as the Rogue Assassin.

Plus, I remember that Riot said that Akali's current version represents her evolution across the years from her old past, when she was in Kinkou. So, in theory, all her lore until now should be cannon ( _without the JoJ for the ancient fossils like me_ ).

> The only line I thought was weird was "The Fist of Shadow was my mom.  I do things differently."  Given that's her old title, I'm interested in learning whatever that means.

The Fist of Shadow is a title for the Kinkou order who is responsible for eliminating its enemies. What she means in that line is that she is no longer part of the kinkou trio and now works on her own path defending Ionia.

Well when you put it that way, it does suit her. I guess I built up an image of what I would like to see the most and it spoilt my objective take on her lore. Thanks! :)

It's very sweet to know this now. From her bio it seemed discreet but I'm very happy to know that she is fond of Kennen - and hopefully we learn more of their bond as the two ninjas with Ken's eventual VGU.

We don't know these elements unless being told from a voiceline or bio - so it's good to know Riot still considers the two to being close!

That’s not how she comes off at _all_, and if you want her to sound reverent, then she needs new voicelines to reflect that.  Akali sounds bitter and resentful of the Kinkou, and especially of Shen, now finally having been freed.

For example, she says to Master Yi, “Another Master no-one needs!”

To Zed she says, “No more masters!”

Akali sounds like she’s against the whole master-student relationship.  It’s a huge theme in her lines.  To revere the Kinkou would go against all that.
She had TWO of them. One of which is the most annoying thing possible - ~~hamster~~ yordle.
Why isn't Laura Bailey the VA?

What is her line to Kennen? I can't seem to find it anywhere.
A bit late, but her line to Kennen was “What a shame. I liked that little guy.”

Would that be possible to add a couple lines where she says something (through introspection in her head or suggestions via dialogue) about ionia, about noxus, about food, about balance, about her new fancy weapons, about her motivations, her goals, hey daily life... anything really... she doesn't say anything interesting or relevant to her character, other than she is angry :( her VO is so shallow and dull, it hurts. It's fine for her to be quiet, but if you are going to give her few lines, you have to make sure those lines are pertinent and give some insight as to who she is and what she does and what she likes etc, and this VO doesn't deliver.

She does, I did notice that but she does seem kinda cold. Perhaps it shouldn’t be taken so harshly (after all Rakan cheers that he’s single when killing xayah) but for both Shen and Kennen she seems to brush it off like it was nothing.

I’m just curious, I imagine she still cares about them even if she disagrees with their methods,or is that assuming too much? On top of that will we be getting comics or stories like you guys ( as in riot, sorry I don’t know if you worked on it) did for MF? I just have so many questions about the state of all three especially after the VO and I’m not sure if we will ever get answers

I used to love reading champions Lore and events like Bilgewater , but since Varus new Lore every has been bad or just plain boring also all champions that have had a rework lore and the Champs Personality is like they have nothing almost in common with there former self maybe there Name.
I read the old lores and story with such Joy , now nothing the new akali Lore is beyond bad no emotion in lore or ingame lines a B... that likes to kill and dose not like to be told what to do who cares about none but herself very EDGY.
I have given up all hope to find any kind of Joy with this game everything has changed for the worse from gameplay to Lore.
